result.execSummary:
The defendant Dion James Gresham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation today December 18, 2015.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: Sarah Slice Yacoub, DF: Dion James Gresham appeared.  Court called at 4:40 p.m.  Set for Return on Warrant.  DE appears.  There is an agreement.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads No Contest to Ct 1 without the domestic abuse enhancer.  No Contest Plea is entered.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1 without the domestic abuse enhancer. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

- S/W 1 year probation with conditions
- Domestic Abuse Assessment and follow 
-  It is hereby ordered the defendant have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Amanda Marci.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  
- Court costs of $243.00 and $200.00 for the DNA Surcharge
- DE to meet with the payment clerk to set up a payment plan
- DE to report to probation today 12/18/15 
-20 days to appeal
Return on warrant at 12-18-2015 01:00 pm

Court issues warrant and stays.  Return on warrant scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference at 11-06-2015 09:00 am

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Amanda M.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Defendant appeared via video conferencing from the St Croix County jail.

CO; Vlack for Lundell, RPR; Liz Frank, Clerk; E. Ferrill, ADA: Sharon Correll,   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Dion James Gresham appeared from jail via video conf. Defendant does qualify for PD. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.
